[LEXICON]: Archaic vocabulary (e.g., "fourpence-halfpenny," "Mæcenas") may impede modern readability

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shift from Colonial squatter anecdote to historical figures (e.g., Dr. Johnson, Reynolds) without clear connective tissue
[CLARITY]: Assumes reader familiarity with referenced literary/historical figures (e.g., Elia, Liotard)

[SYNTAX]: Awkward phrasing ("whether his stay were short or not");
[LEXICON]: Formal tone with less common vocabulary ("contemptuous," "virility") may slightly impede smooth reading for some readers.

[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt, unrelated topics (artistic career → literary critique → French Revolution → executions) with no transitional connections;
[LOGIC]: Lack of logical progression between historical context and preceding artistic discussion.
